websocket

Class ChatWebsocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • websocket.ChatWebsocket

  • public class ChatWebsocket
extends java.lang.Object
    This websocket contains main logic of an app. It authenticates user after session is opened, then processes incoming messages. Class is responsible for generating new words to guess and choosing next drawing user. It also produces scoreboard.
    Author:
    Piotr Ko³odziejski

    • Method Detail

      • onOpen

        public void onOpen(javax.websocket.Session session)
        Initial procedures when websocket session is opened.
        Parameters:
        session - current session

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(javax.websocket.Session s,
                      java.lang.String message)
        Proceeds incoming websocket messages. On very first message it expects JWT token to authenticate the user. If user is not valid it closes the session. Messages are processed based on message type (see enum ChatMessage.MsgType). Method contaings main logic: processing messages, adding active users, generating new word, choosing next drawing users, closing session in case of fatal internal errors.
        Parameters:
        s - current websocket session
        message - incoming message

      • onClose

        public void onClose(javax.websocket.Session session)
             throws GameIntegrityViolationException
        Method is being invoked when websocket session is closed. It removes user from active users. In case drawing user is leaving the game it ensures that next drawing user is chosen.
        Parameters:
        session - current session
        Throws:
        GameIntegrityViolationException - in case of error during word generation, setting new drawing user, setting new word to guess or obtaining data from app dictionary.
